docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. WIKOFF has written a letter to the eveningg Post respecting the publication in that paper of his statement of the articles of jewelry, costly dresses, gold pencil cases, silver plate, , which were presented to his friend, the Editor of the Herald, by Mademoiselle FANNY ELLSLER, for the purpose of conciliating that " craving shark of the press," as Mr. WIKOb F called him.
docs.abstract: Letter on Md. Ellsler's presents to Bennett

docs.lead_paragraph: NIBLO'S GARDEN.--The complimentary benefit tendered to Mr. THEODORE EISFELDT, director of the Philharmonic Society, comes off to-night, and we be-speak for the occasion a brilliant and encouraging attendance. docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. JOHN C. SPENCER, after an illness of many-months, died on Thursday night at his residence in Albany. There are few men more widely known and respected than was Mr. SPENCER. He was the eldest son of Chief Justice SPENCER: was born in 1787, and has occupied a prominent place in the political history of the State during nearly half a century. was educated for the

headline.main: JUDGE CONKLING'S OPINION.; Judge Conkling on Search and Selzure, in Reply to Mr. Hill.

docs.lead_paragraph: CORRESPONDENCE. ALBANY, Wednesday, May 9, 1854. Hon. ALFRED CONKLING: Dear Sir:--Opinions are now being obtained from distinguished lawyers, to prejudice the public mind, to bias the Courts of Justice, and perhaps secure the repeal of the Prohibitory Liquor Law, enacted at the late session of the New-York Legislature.
docs.abstract: Opinion of Judge Conkling in favour of the Law

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; The Political Trials--Movements of American and Foreign Vessels of War.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have on new events to chronicle, growing out of the action of the "Military Commission," although the Queen's Attorney has been busy in hunting for material and preparing suspicious circumstances, for such victims as justice may require.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; MORE ABOUT BAKER. A Word from the Poole Association. BAKER'S OWN ACCOUNT OF HIS ARREST. Board of Education. Meeting of the Committee on Railroads. The New Steamer Arago. Alleged Case of Seduction. Supposed Murder of an Infant. Sealed to Death. The Knife-Stabbing Cases. Meeting of the Bricklayers Benevolent Protective Union. Cricket at Newark, N. J. Fires. Mayor's Office. Alleged Grand Larceny. COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the Orizaba, at New-Orleans, we have news from Vera Cruz to the 8th inst., and from the City of Mexico to the 5th. The papers represent the country to be in the most deplorable condition.
